column4: BRIEF-Waters Corporation Announces CEO Succession Plan
column6: * WATERS CORP - BOARD & CHRISTOPHER O’CONNELL HAVE MUTUALLY AGREED THAT O’CONNELL WILL STEP DOWN AS PRESIDENT, CEO
column7: * WATERS CORP - O’CONNELL WILL REMAIN WITH WATERS AS AN ADVISOR UNTIL END OF THIS YEAR TO SUPPORT TRANSITION
column8: * WATERS CORP - BOARD IS ACTIVELY WORKING WITH AN EXECUTIVE SEARCH FIRM TO ASSIST IN CEO TRANSITION PROCESS Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:

column4: BRIEF-Waters Corporation Reports Q1 EPS Of $0.86
column6: * ORATION (NYSE: WAT) REPORTS FIRST QUARTER 2020 FINANCIAL RESULTS
column7: * Q1 SALES $465 MILLION VERSUS REFINITIV IBES ESTIMATE OF $488.5 MILLION
column8: * Q1 EARNINGS PER SHARE ESTIMATE $1.44 -- REFINITIV IBES DATA
column9: * WITHDRAWING FULL-YEAR 2020 FINANCIAL GUIDANCE DUE TO COVID-19 UNCERTAINTIES
column10: * REVISED 2020 CAPITAL DEPLOYMENT PLANS TO IMPROVE CASH FLOW BY AN ESTIMATED $45 MILLION

column4: BRIEF-Waters Corp Executive Committee Agrees To Temporary Reduction In Base Salary For 90-Day Period
column6: * WATERS CORP - CO AND EACH MEMBER OF EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE HAVE AGREED TO TEMPORARY REDUCTION IN BASE SALARY FOR 90-DAY PERIOD BEGINNING ON APRIL 26
column7: * WATERS CORP - CO’S CEO, CHRISTOPHER J. O’CONNELL, HAS AGREED TO A 40% REDUCTION IN BASE SALARY
column8: * WATERS CORP - EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, SHERRY BUCK, KEELEY ALEMAN, MICHAEL HARRINGTON, JONATHAN PRATT, HAS AGREED TO 30% REDUCTION IN BASE SALARY Source : (bit.ly/3bLqyyD) Further company coverage:
